subject: SDS
title: Introduction to Social Policy Processes
description: This course examines the policy-making process in Canada at the municipal, provincial, and federal levels to give students a sense of the players and their roles. It examines how policy agendas are set and the role of power and interest groups in the policy-making process. It also examines the various types of policies and the implementation process. [Note: Formerly ISS 231R]
